title: Are GMOs good or bad?

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why genetic engineering is treated differently when it comes to food and agriculture, compared to medical applications?

options.label: A
options.text: The debate heats up when it comes to food and agriculture because genetic engineering is used in many fields, but the debate is more intense when it comes to food and agriculture.

options.label: B
options.text: The main reason is that genetic engineering is more effective for medical applications than for food and agriculture.

options.label: C
options.text: The main reason is that humans have been genetically modifying plants and animals for thousands of years, making genetic engineering more acceptable in food and agriculture.

options.label: D
options.text: The main reason is that genetic engineering is not as effective for food and agriculture as it is for medical applications.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the unintentional spreading of engineered DNA?
What is the purpose of BT crops?

options.label: A
options.text: To produce a protein that destroys the digestive system of specific insect pests.

options.label: B
options.text: To produce a protein that is harmless to humans.

options.label: C
options.text: To produce a protein that is toxic to humans.

options.label: D
options.text: To produce a protein that is resistant to certain weed killers.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main criticism of the use of glyphosate in modern agriculture?

options.label: C
options.text: It has a strong incentive for farmers to rely on it, casting more balanced ways of managing weeds aside.

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential benefit of using GMOs in agriculture?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the use of pesticides.

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce the use of pesticides.

options.label: C
options.text: To increase the use of fertilizers.

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce the use of fertilizers.

options.label: A
options.text: To produce plants that are more resistant to droughts and floods.

options.label: B
options.text: To produce plants that are more susceptible to droughts and floods.

options.label: C
options.text: To produce plants that are more resistant to extreme temperatures.

options.label: D
options.text: To produce plants that are more susceptible to extreme temperatures.

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential benefit of using GMOs to collect nitrogen from the air?

options.label: A
options.text: To reduce the use of fertilizers in the developed world.

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the use of fertilizers in the developed world.

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce the use of fertilizers in developing countries.

options.label: D
options.text: To increase the use of fertilizers in developing countries.

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential benefit of using GMOs to collect carbon dioxide from the air?

options.label: A
options.text: To reduce the effects of climate change.

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the effects of climate change.

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce the use of fossil fuels.

options.label: D
options.text: To increase the use of fossil fuels.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main argument against the use of GMOs in agriculture?
What is the potential benefit of using GMOs in agriculture to reduce the impact on the environment?

options.label: A
options.text: To reduce the use of pesticides and fertilizers.

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the use of pesticides and fertilizers.

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce the use of water.

options.label: D
options.text: To increase the use of water.

options.label: C
options.text: To prevent a threat from escalating to dangerous levels inside the body

options.label: D

options.label: D
options.text: It helps the body develop immunity to certain diseases

options.label: C
options.text: To help clear bodily toxins and waste

title: How do fish make electricity? - Eleanor Nelsen

multiple-choice.question: Who is the explorer who witnessed a swarm of electric eels leap out of the water to defend themselves against oncoming horses?
What is the primary function of the electrical signals produced by fish?

options.label: B
options.text: To communicate, navigate, and find prey

options.label: B
options.text: To incapacitate the prey and then swallow it alive

options.label: C
options.text: To stimulate the prey's muscles and generate waves to reveal its hiding place

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of the electrocytes in the electric organs of fish?

options.label: A
options.text: To produce sodium and potassium ions

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the group of fish that produce weak electric signals?
What is the primary function of the electroreceptors in the skin of fish?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect changes in the electrical field

multiple-choice.question: How many species of fish have specialized anatomical structures that generate and detect electrical signals?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The size of strongly electric fish allows them to withstand their own shocks

options.label: C
options.text: The current passes out of their bodies too quickly

options.label: D
options.text: They do not produce strong electrical discharges

title: The complicated history of surfing - Scott Laderman

multiple-choice.question: Where did surfing originate?

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: It was a recreational activity with spiritual and social significance

options.label: C
options.text: It was a way to demonstrate wealth

options.label: D
options.text: It was a way to prove bravery

multiple-choice.question: What type of boards did Hawaiian surfers ride, and what were they used for?

options.label: A
options.text: Alaia boards were thin, midsized boards used by surfers of all ages, and paipo boards were short, round-nosed boards used by riders who typically lay on their stomachs.

options.label: B
options.text: Paipo boards were used by beginners, and alaia boards were used by experts

options.label: C
options.text: Alaia boards were used by surfers who wanted to ride long waves, and paipo boards were used by surfers who wanted to ride short waves

options.label: D
options.text: Paipo boards were used by surfers of all ages, and alaia boards were used by surfers who wanted to ride short waves

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They were able to overthrow the native monarchy

options.label: C

options.text: They were able to annex the islands without any issues

options.label: D
options.text: It is only practiced by tourists

options.label: C
options.text: Olo boards, which were twice as long as today's longboards
